FuncDef: The display mpls ldp lsp traffic-statistics command displays LDP traffic statistics.
CLIs: display mpls ldp lsp traffic-statistics [ <ipv4-address> <mask-length> ] [ verbose ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays LDP traffic statistics with the specified route prefix.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Displays LDP traffic statistics with a specified route prefix mask length.
The value is fixed at 32.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display mpls ldp lsp traffic-statistics verbose
Last 300 seconds output rate 24000 bits/sec, 1050 packets/sec
Realtime 30 seconds output rate 2400 bits/sec, 105 packets/sec
FEC                In/Out Label  Out Interface    Out Packets/Bytes
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After MPLS and MPLS statistics collection are enabled, to view LDP traffic statistics, run the display mpls ldp lsp traffic-statistics command.If MPLS traffic statistics collection is enable, the traffic statistics of an LDP LSP start to be collected only after the LDP LSP is created, and will be reset and recollected if the LDP LSP deleted and reestablished. To check the status of an LDP LSP, run the display mpls lsp command. To check the last down time of an LDP LSP, run the display mpls last-info lsp-down command.
